methane_importance.description: Methane is a potent greenhouse gas that significantly contributes to climate change. It is over 25 times more effective than carbon dioxide at trapping heat in the atmosphere over a 100-year period.

climate_change.details: Methane emissions are responsible for approximately 30% of the global warming observed since the pre-industrial era.

emission_sources.details: Major sources of methane emissions include agriculture (especially livestock), landfills, natural gas production, and wetlands.

atmospheric_concentration.details: The concentration of methane in the atmosphere has more than doubled since the 1750s, reaching levels that are concerning for climate stability.

current_technologies.description: Various technologies are currently employed to measure methane emissions, each with its own advantages and applications.

technologies.name: Hyperspectral Imaging
technologies.details: This technology captures a wide spectrum of light to identify methane concentrations in the atmosphere.

technologies.name: Lidar Detection
technologies.details: Lidar uses laser pulses to detect methane concentrations and can provide high-resolution data over large areas.

technologies.name: Ground Sensors
technologies.details: These sensors are deployed at various locations to continuously monitor methane levels and provide real-time data.

satellite_technologies.description: Satellite technologies play a crucial role in monitoring methane emissions globally.

satellites.name: Carbon Mapper
satellites.details: Carbon Mapper is designed to provide high-resolution data on methane emissions from various sources.

satellites.name: MethaneSat
satellites.details: MethaneSat aims to monitor methane emissions from oil and gas operations, landfills, and agriculture.

satellites.name: GHGSat
satellites.details: GHGSat provides satellite-based monitoring of greenhouse gas emissions, focusing on industrial sources.

satellites.name: AVIRIS-NG
satellites.details: AVIRIS-NG is a hyperspectral imaging system that captures detailed information about methane emissions.
